comment: Ventre is one of the best professors I've had at KSU. She is up front with her expectations, and she is always available to help students. We even did a bunch of reviews to prep for exams. Her lectures are hilarious--but she will not accept excuses. If you don't come to class, you won't do well.

Very kind and knowledgable professor! Premodern history is boring but she actually makes it interesting and keeps you engaged. 3 tests, 2 projects, random attendance, and a final exam. Class is actually pretty easy, only reason I didn't do as well is because I did not take studying as serious as I should have. Loved her, please take her class!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ventre is amazing! Premodern can be super boring but her lectures are always energetic and lively. There's only 6 grades: attendance, 3 tests, and 2 group projects, so be wary of that. Her tests aren't hard as long as you pay attention during lectures and during her review session. Such an amazing professor would highly recommend!
She is incredible, her lectures are entertaining, and she keeps things light. By far the best professor I have had so far at ksu. You will not regret taking this class!

Be careful while taking this professor she was no help when I had asked about talking to her about studying. She had said yeah I'd be available after class (ONLY ). Just for the following week to say oh yeah I have two people coming so I won't be available.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She is so fun and makes lectures interesting, but her exams are so difficult and she words things so poorly that most people fail. Exams are paper pencil and are worth 55 percent of your grade. Random attendance in class too

Professor Ventre is great! Premodern history can be a bore at times (at least for me) but Professor Ventre weaves modern events that students can relate to into her lectures making the material fun to learn.

The only class I have ever received a C in... She isn't very clear about what the tests are over. Most people failed every test we took. Her debate project in class is very unfair because your grade is based on what the whole class thinks.

Ventre is awesome! She really wants you to be successful, and you can tell that she actually cares about her students. The content is tough, but she always provides help when needed. Her lectures are hilarious. If you don't show up or read, you won't do well.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Grades hard with no evaluation on the rubric. No feedback and doesn't use the rubric. She only has 5 grades which can be a god sent gift and the biggest pain. 2 exams, 2 papers, and then one final project instead of a final exam. One paper is final. No study material.  Attendance is mandatory??? Exams are super specific and detailed 50 questions.

There is only 5 grades in this class so the exams cover a lot of content so be ready to read. She is really cool though and very energetic but she also knows how to keep it real with her students which is nice. This class covers very old history which is not always easy to be engaged with but just try your best and read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She is a nice person but I wouldn't take her again. I'd study, read the textbook, take notes, ask questions, read the slides and still wouldn't do well on the tests. Many of us were upset by that. You also have to write a paper, which is super, super graded. She does make a lot of jokes and always has enthusiasm and tries to make class interesting.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ventre teaches with great enthusiasm and tries her best to engage every student. She makes it clear that students are responsible for reading the textbook outside of class as her (amazing) lectures elaborate on topics not covered in the textbook. I highly recommend! She has a charming personality and wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ventre is without a doubt the BEST professor at KSU. She's supportive, cracks jokes a lot during class. Attendance is 100% mandatory but she allows up to 3 absences without reason. It's a little bit of a difficult class but she's definitely worth taking for a gen ed class. I can't recommend her class enough.

Professor Ventre is a super cool professor. She makes her lectures fun and cracks jokes whenever the chance presents itself. I will say she has high standards for her students but goes out of her way to make sure that they are met. There is only 5 grades in the class. 2 exams, 1 essay, 1 debate, and your final in a group/partner project.

The class is made up of 5 grades; 2 exams,1 paper, 2 projects. Though she is passionate about her subject, she has very unrealistic expectations, especially for a gen ed. Attendance is mandatory, and every exam and assignment is due in class. Both projects are group projects, and your grade is dependent on that of your group members participation.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Ventre is a rare example of a professor who has high expectations but actually cares enough about their job to help her students meet her standards. Never a dull moment in lectures; she does a great job of getting everyone involved in class. If you're struggling, all you have to do is ask and she will help. Would take her again if I could.
